summary: The "Body of European Regulators for Electronic Communications" (BEREC) is an essential institution within the EU framework, established to enhance regulatory cooperation among national regulatory authorities in the electronic communications sector. BEREC's primary mandate is to ensure consistent application of EU regulations, thereby fostering a competitive internal market for electronic communications. It provides expert advice and guidance on regulatory practices, contributing to the development of a coherent regulatory environment. By facilitating collaboration and sharing best practices, BEREC plays a pivotal role in promoting consumer protection and ensuring the integrity of electronic communications across member states.
